Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of male cult follower, possibly follower of Harpocrates. Head only, missing top and back of head. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating and red paint. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop that was operational from the 3rd to the 2nd century BC. Similar piece from Naukratis (Cambridge MCA, NA696) and in Dresden dated late 1st century BC to early 1st century AD (Fischer 1994, no.464). Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.573) (Phase 1)
